t: Luke 22
Preparing the Passover
Now*p the Feast of Unleavened Bread, which is called the Passover, was approaching.
The chief priests and the scribes were seeking how they might put Him to death; for they were afraid of the people.
And*p Satan entered into Judas who was called Iscariot, belonging to the number of the twelve.
And he went away and discussed with the chief priests and officers how he might betray Him to them.
They were glad and agreed to give him money.
So he consented, and began*i seeking a good opportunity to betray Him to them apart from the crowd.
Then*p came the first*i day of Unleavened Bread on which the Passover lamb*i had to be sacrificed.
And Jesus sent Peter and John, saying, “Go*r and*r prepare*r the*r Passover*r for*r us,*r so*r that*r we*r may*r eat*r it.”*r
They said to Him, “Where do You want us to prepare it?”
And He said to them, “When*r you*r have*r entered*r the*r city,*r a*r man*r will*r meet*r you*r carrying*r a*r pitcher*r of*r water;*r follow*r him*r into*r the*r house*r that*r he*r enters.*r

And*r you*r shall*r say*r to*r the*r owner*r of*r the*r house,*r ‘The*r Teacher*r says*r to*r you,*r “Where*r is*r the*r guest*r room*r in*r which*r I*r may*r eat*r the*r Passover*r with*r My*r disciples?” ’*r
And*r he*r will*r show*r you*r a*r large,*r furnished*r upper*r room;*r prepare*r it*r there.”*r
And they left and found everything*i just as He had told them; and they prepared the Passover.
The Lord’s Supper
When*p the hour had come, He reclined at*i the*i table,*i and the apostles with Him.
And He said to them, “I*r have*r earnestly*r desired*r to*r eat*r this*r Passover*r with*r you*r before*r I*r suffer;*r
for*r I*r say*r to*r you,*r I*r shall*r never*r again*r eat*r it*r until*r it*r is*r fulfilled*r in*r the*r kingdom*r of*r God.”*r
And when He had taken a cup and*i given thanks, He said, “Take*r this*r and*r share*r it*r among*r yourselves;*r
for*r I*r say*r to*r you,*r I*r will*r not*r drink*r of*r the*r fruit*r of*r the*r vine*r from*r now*r on*r until*r the*r kingdom*r of*r God*r comes.”*r
And when He had taken some*i bread and*i given thanks, He broke it and gave it to them, saying, “This*r is*r My*r body*r which*r is*r given*r for*r you;*r do*r this*r in*r remembrance*r of*r Me.”*r
And in the same way He*i took*i the cup after they had eaten, saying, “This*r cup*r which*r is*r poured*r out*r for*r you*r is*r the*r new*r covenant*r in*r My*r blood.*r
But*r behold,*r the*r hand*r of*r the*r one*r betraying*r Me*r is*r with*r Mine*r on*r the*r table.*r
For*r indeed,*r the*r Son*r of*r Man*r is*r going*r as*r it*r has*r been*r determined;*r but*r woe*r to*r that*r man*r by*r whom*r He*r is*r betrayed!”*r
And they began to discuss among themselves which one of them it might be who was going to do this thing.
Who Is Greatest
And*p there arose also a dispute among them as*i to*i which one of them was regarded to be greatest.
And He said to them, “The*r kings*r of*r the*r Gentiles*r lord*r it*r over*r them;*r and*r those*r who*r have*r authority*r over*r them*r are*r called*r ‘Benefactors.’*r
But*r it*ir is*ir not*r this*r way*r with*r you,*r but*r the*r one*r who*r is*r the*r greatest*r among*r you*r must*r become*r like*r the*r youngest,*r and*r the*r leader*r like*r the*r servant.*r

For*r who*r is*r greater,*r the*r one*r who*r reclines*r at*ir the*ir table*ir or*r the*r one*r who*r serves?*r Is*r it*r not*r the*r one*r who*r reclines*r at*ir the*ir table?*ir But*r I*r am*r among*r you*r as*r the*r one*r who*r serves.*r
“You*rp are*r those*r who*r have*r stood*r by*r Me*r in*r My*r trials;*r
and*r just*r as*r My*r Father*r has*r granted*r Me*r a*r kingdom,*r I*r grant*r you*r
that*r you*r may*r eat*r and*r drink*r at*r My*r table*r in*r My*r kingdom,*r and*r you*r will*r sit*r on*r thrones*r judging*r the*r twelve*r tribes*r of*r Israel.*r
“Simon,*rp Simon,*r behold,*r Satan*r has*r demanded*r permission*ir to*r sift*r you*r like*r wheat;*r
but*r I*r have*r prayed*r for*r you,*r that*r your*r faith*r may*r not*r fail;*r and*r you,*r when*r once*r you*r have*r turned*r again,*r strengthen*r your*r brothers.”*r
But he said to Him, “Lord, with You I am ready to go both to prison and to death!”
And He said, “I*r say*r to*r you,*r Peter,*r the*r rooster*r will*r not*r crow*r today*r until*r you*r have*r denied*r three*r times*r that*r you*r know*r Me.”*r
And*p He said to them, “When*r I*r sent*r you*r out*r without*r money*r belt*r and*r bag*r and*r sandals,*r you*r did*r not*r lack*r anything,*r did*r you?”*r They said, “No,*i nothing.”

And He said to them, “But*r now,*r whoever*r has*r a*r money*r belt*r is*r to*r take*r it*r along,*r likewise*r also*r a*r bag,*r and*r whoever*r has*r no*r sword*r is*r to*r sell*r his*r coat*r and*r buy*r one.*r

For*r I*r tell*r you*r that*r this*r which*r is*r written*r must*r be*r fulfilled*r in*r Me,*r ‘And*r He*sr was*sr numbered*sr with*sr transgressors’;*sr for*r that*r which*r refers*r to*r Me*r has*r its*ir fulfillment.”*r
They said, “Lord, look, here are two swords.” And He said to them, “It*r is*r enough.”*r
The Garden of Gethsemane
And*p He came out and proceeded as was His custom to the Mount of Olives; and the disciples also followed Him.
When He arrived at the place, He said to them, “Pray*r that*r you*r may*r not*r enter*r into*r temptation.”*r
And He withdrew from them about a stone’s throw, and He knelt down and began*i to pray,
saying, “Father,*r if*r You*r are*r willing,*r remove*r this*r cup*r from*r Me;*r yet*r not*r My*r will,*r but*r Yours*r be*r done.”*r
Now an angel from heaven appeared to Him, strengthening Him.
And being in agony He was praying very fervently; and His sweat became like drops of blood, falling down upon the ground.
When He rose from prayer, He came to the disciples and found them sleeping from sorrow,
and said to them, “Why*r are*r you*r sleeping?*r Get*r up*r and*r pray*r that*r you*r may*r not*r enter*r into*r temptation.”*r
Jesus Betrayed by Judas
While*p He was still speaking, behold, a crowd came,*i and the one called Judas, one of the twelve, was preceding them; and he approached Jesus to kiss Him.
But Jesus said to him, “Judas,*r are*r you*r betraying*r the*r Son*r of*r Man*r with*r a*r kiss?”*r
When those who were around Him saw what was going to happen, they said, “Lord, shall we strike with the sword?”
And one of them struck the slave of the high priest and cut off his right ear.
But Jesus answered and said, “Stop!*r No*r more*r of*r this.”*r And He touched his ear and healed him.

Then Jesus said to the chief priests and officers of the temple and elders who had come against Him, “Have*r you*r come*r out*r with*r swords*r and*r clubs*r as*r you*r would*r against*r a*r robber?*r
While*r I*r was*r with*r you*r daily*r in*r the*r temple,*r you*r did*r not*r lay*r hands*r on*r Me;*r but*r this*r hour*r and*r the*r power*r of*r darkness*r are*r yours.”*r
Jesus’ Arrest
Having*p arrested Him, they led Him away*i and brought Him to the house of the high priest; but Peter was following at a distance.
After they had kindled a fire in the middle of the courtyard and had sat down together, Peter was sitting among them.
And a servant-girl, seeing him as he sat in the firelight and looking intently at him, said, “This man was with Him too.”
But he denied it,*i saying, “Woman, I do not know Him.”
A little later, another saw him and said, “You are one*i of them too!” But Peter said, “Man, I am not!”
After about an hour had passed, another man began*i to insist, saying, “Certainly this man also was with Him, for he is a Galilean too.”
But Peter said, “Man, I do not know what you are talking about.” Immediately, while he was still speaking, a rooster crowed.
The Lord turned and looked at Peter. And Peter remembered the word of the Lord, how He had told him, “Before*r a*r rooster*r crows*r today,*r you*r will*r deny*r Me*r three*r times.”*r
And he went out and wept bitterly.
Now*p the men who were holding Jesus in custody were mocking Him and beating Him,
and they blindfolded Him and were asking Him, saying, “Prophesy, who is the one who hit You?”
And they were saying many other things against Him, blaspheming.
Jesus before the Sanhedrin
When*p it was day, the Council of elders of the people assembled, both chief priests and scribes, and they led Him away to their council chamber,*i saying,
“If You are the Christ, tell us.” But He said to them, “If*r I*r tell*r you,*r you*r will*r not*r believe;*r
and*r if*r I*r ask*r a*r question,*r you*r will*r not*r answer.*r
But*r from*r now*r on*r the*sr Son*sr of*sr Man*sr will*sr be*sr seated*sr at*sr the*sr right*sr hand*sr of*r the*r power*r of*sr God.”*sr
And they all said, “Are You the Son of God, then?” And He said to them, “Yes,*r I*r am.”*r
Then they said, “What further need do we have of testimony? For we have heard it ourselves from His own mouth.”
